title: CDIF Provenance Activity
description: Extended provenance activity building block for CDIF. Extends the minimal prov:Activity (generatedBy) with schema.org Action properties for comprehensive provenance documentation including agents, instruments, methodology, temporal bounds, action chaining, and more.

allOf.title: very simple links or names of software or instruments used to generate a resource.

@id.description: a resolvable reference to a representation of the software or instrument used

@type.description: Must include both schema:Action and prov:Activity (prov:Activity required by base generatedBy schema)

schema:name.description: Human-readable name for the activity

schema:description.description: Text description of what this activity did

schema:propertyID.description: In this context for the schema:PropertyValue, this field is an identifier for the identifier schema, e.g. DOI, ARK.  Get values from https://registry.identifiers.org/registry/ for interoperability

schema:url.description: web-resolveable string for the identifier; host name part is location of a resolver that will return some representation for the given identifier value. E.g. https://doi.org/10.5066/F7VX0DMQ

schema:agent.description: Primary responsible agent for this activity (maps to PROV wasAssociatedWith)

anyOf.description: schema for cdif profile of schema.org/Person

schema:name.description: string label for person that is meaningful for human users

schema:propertyID.description: In this context for the schema:PropertyValue, this field is an identifier for the identifier schema, e.g. DOI, ARK.  Get values from https://registry.identifiers.org/registry/ for interoperability

schema:url.description: web-resolveable string for the identifier; host name part is location of a resolver that will return some representation for the given identifier value. E.g. https://doi.org/10.5066/F7VX0DMQ

schema:alternateName.description: other labels by which the person might be known

anyOf.description: For more granularity on how a person contributed to a Dataset, use schema:Role. The schema.org documentation does not state that the Role type is an expected data type of author, creator and contributor, but that is addressed in this blog post (http://blog.schema.org/2014/06/introducing-role.html). see https://github.com/ESIPFed/science-on-schema.org/blob/develop/guides/Dataset.md#roles-of-people

anyOf.description: schema for a labeled link, a profile of schema.org/CreativeWork

@id.description: reference to an instrument defined elsewhere

schema:object.description: Input entity for this activity (for action chaining, references the result of a prior activity)

schema:result.description: Output entity produced by this activity (for action chaining, can be referenced as object of a subsequent activity)

schema:startTime.description: ISO8601 date-time when the activity started (maps to PROV startedAtTime)

schema:endTime.description: ISO8601 date-time when the activity ended (maps to PROV endedAtTime)

anyOf.description: Spatial Extent description for CDIF discovery profile.  Note required prefix declaration for geoSparql ( http://www.opengis.net/ont/geosparql#) and OGC simple features (sf: http://www.opengis.net/ont/sf#)

schema:name.description: multiple place names or DefinedTerms that have a place name and URI for the location
text label for the term that is useful to human user

schema:propertyID.description: In this context for the schema:PropertyValue, this field is an identifier for the identifier schema, e.g. DOI, ARK.  Get values from https://registry.identifiers.org/registry/ for interoperability

schema:inDefinedTermSet.description: Identifier for the controlled vocabulary responsible for this keyword.

schema:termCode.description: A representative code for this keyword in the controlled vocabulary (Optional).  Analogous to skos:Notation

schema:geo.description: Either a bounding box or a point location.

anyOf.description: A point location. Point locations are recommended for data that is associated with specific sample locations, particularly if these are widely spaced such that an enclosing bounding box would be a misleading representation of the spatial location. Be aware that some client applications might only index or display bounding box extents or a single point location.

A schema:GeoShape bounding box. The geometry is described with a set of latitude/longitude pairs (in that order).The documentation for schema:GeoShape states 'Either whitespace or commas can be used to separate latitude and longitude; whitespace should be used when writing a list of several such points.'

schema:box.description: A GeoShape box defines an area on the surface of the earth defined by point locations of the southwest corner and northeast corner of the rectangle in latitude-longitude coordinates. A space should be used to separate the latitude and longitude values. The two corner coordinate points are separated by a space. 'East longitude' means positive longitude values are east of the prime (Greenwich) meridian.

anyOf.description: A schema:GeoShape curvilinear trace, for resource related to a linear trace like a ship track or airplane flight line

schema:line.description: A GeoShape box defines a curvilinear geometry as a string of latitude-longitude coordinates. A space should be used to separate the latitude and longitude values. The coordinate point pairs are also separated by a space. 'East longitude' means positive longitude values are east of the prime (Greenwich) meridian. e.g. '39.33 120.77 40.44 123.96 41.00 121.34'

geosparql:hasGeometry.description: Optional geographic extent using wkt geometry, see Ocean InfoHub (https://book.oceaninfohub.org/thematics/spatial/README.html#simple-geosparql-wkt). Other geometry schemes might be specified in a specific domain profile, e.g. for atmospheric, subsurface data, or local coordinate systems. NOTE that the location specified here should be the same as the schema.org point or contained within the specified bounding box.

@type.description: MUST be sf: (<http://www.opengis.net/ont/sf#>) SimpleFeature geometry type. See https://opengeospatial.github.io/ogc-geosparql/geosparql11/sf_geometries.ttl

@value.description: a WKT geometry description string, e.g. 'POINT(-76 -18)'

@id.description: identifier string for coordinate reference system, e.g., 'CRS84'
reference to a place defined elsewhere

schema:actionProcess.description: Methodology or protocol for this activity

anyOf.description: A methodology or protocol described as a HowTo with optional steps

schema:name.description: Name of the methodology or protocol

schema:url.description: URL to a published methodology or protocol document

items.description: A single step in a HowTo methodology

schema:name.description: Name of this step

schema:description.description: Description of what this step involves

schema:url.description: URL to documentation for this step

@id.description: reference to a methodology defined elsewhere

schema:propertyID.description: identifier or name for the property concept quantified by the values in this variable slot. Multiple values can specify the property at different levels of granularity.
